segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 17. Paṭipadāvagga
segments.en: 17. Practice

segments.pli: 169. Sasaṅkhārasutta
segments.en: 169. Extra Effort

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo diṭṭheva dhamme sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: One person becomes fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kāyassa bhedā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: One person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo diṭṭheva dhamme asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: One person becomes fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kāyassa bhedā asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: One person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo diṭṭheva dhamme sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a person become fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu asubhānupassī kāye viharati, āhāre paṭikūlasaññī, sabbaloke anabhiratisaññī, sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions,

segments.pli: Maraṇasaññā kho panassa ajjhattaṃ sūpaṭṭhitā hoti.
segments.en: and has well established the perception of their own death.

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ, hiribalaṃ, ottappabalaṃ, vīriyabalaṃ, paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni adhimattāni pātubhavanti—
segments.en: And they have these five faculties strongly:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ, satindriyaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ, paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ adhimattattā diṭṭheva dhamme sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: Because of the strength of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo diṭṭheva dhamme sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo kāyassa bhedā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti?
segments.en: How does a person become fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu asubhānupassī kāye viharati, āhāre paṭikūlasaññī, sabbaloke anabhiratisaññī, sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions,

segments.pli: Maraṇasaññā kho panassa ajjhattaṃ sūpaṭṭhitā hoti.
segments.en: and has well established the perception of their own death.

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ, hiribalaṃ, ottappabalaṃ, vīriyabalaṃ, paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni mudūni pātubhavanti—
segments.en: But they have these five faculties weakly:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ, satindriyaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ, paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ muduttā kāyassa bhedā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: Because of the weakness of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo kāyassa bhedā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo diṭṭheva dhamme asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a person become fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi … pe … paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant … enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption …

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ … pe … paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni adhimattāni pātubhavanti—
segments.en: And they have these five faculties strongly:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ adhimattattā diṭṭheva dhamme asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: Because of the strength of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo diṭṭheva dhamme asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo kāyassa bhedā asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a person become fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi … pe … paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ … pe … catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant … enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption …

segments.pli: So imāni pañca sekhabalāni upanissāya viharati—
segments.en: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:

segments.pli: saddhābalaṃ, hiribalaṃ, ottappabalaṃ, vīriyabalaṃ, paññābalaṃ.
segments.en: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tassimāni pañcindriyāni … pe … paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: But they have these five faculties weakly: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: So imesaṃ pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ muduttā kāyassa bhedā asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: Because of the weakness of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo kāyassa bhedā asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.
